title: God Of War TV Show May Have Found Another Actor

body:

                Following the recent announcement that Ryan Hurst will play Kratos in the upcoming God of War TV series at Prime Video, another casting detail has come to light.Deadline reports that Teresa Palmer will star on the show as Phoebe/Sif, who is Thor's wife. The Australian actor and model is known for her work on the TV shows The Family Next Door and The Last Anniversary. She also had roles in the movies Warm Bodies and The Fall Guy.The God of War TV show, which hails from Battlestar Galactica's Ronald D. Moore, has already been ordered for two seasons. Frederick E.O. Toye (The Boys, Fallout) is directing the first two episodes. There is no release date yet.Prime Video is also behind the upcoming Tomb Raider live-action TV show starring Sophie Turner.The God of War TV show will follow some of the events of 2018's God of War and 2022's God of War Ragnarok, telling the father-son story of Kratos and Atreus. There is no word yet on who may play Atreus, or any of the other parts, however.God of War is one of Sony's best-known franchises, and while no future games have been announced, it's expected the series will continue. A live-service God of War game, however, was reportedly canceled last year.

title: Ryan Hurst Reacts To Being Cast As Kratos In God Of War TV Series
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                                          Ryan Hurst was just recently...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                Ryan Hurst was just recently announced as the actor who will play Kratos in the upcoming God of War live-action TV series. The Sons of Anarchy actor has now reacted to the announcement, saying he feels "grateful to pick up the axe."Posting on Instagram, Hurst wrote, "Used to play as him. Now I get to be him."He added: "Grateful to pick up the axe, and honored by the fans who made this story legendary."Hurst is no stranger to the world of God of War, as he played Thor in God of War Ragnarok. The TV series is expected to follow the events of 2018's God of War and 2022's God of War Ragnarok, featuring the father-and-son story between Kratos and Atreus. It remains to be seen who may play Atreus, or any of the other roles, but with the show reportedly set to begin filming in Vancouver this March, further casting announcements and other details may come soon.As announced previously, Battlestar Galactica's Ronald D. Moore is the showrunner, executive producer, and writer for the God of War show. Sony Pictures Television and Amazon MGM Studios are producing the series, alongside PlayStation Productions and Tall Ship Productions.Frederick E.O. Toye (The Boys, Fallout) is directing the first two episodes. There is no release date yet, but the series will air on Prime Video. The streamer is also behind the upcoming Tomb Raider live-action TV show starring Sophie Turner.As for the God of War game series, it is expected to continue, but no new games have been announced.

                Arc Raiders was one of the big hits from 2025, and Embark isn't going to let that momentum wane in 2026. The studio has indicated that there are multiple new maps on the horizon, as well as an upcoming content roadmap."There are going to be multiple maps coming this year," said Arc Raiders design lead Virgil Watkins during an interview with GamesRadar. "And I think it's going to be across a spectrum of size to try to facilitate different types of gameplay. So you might see some that are smaller, and you might see some that are even grander than what we've got now."Watkins didn't share specific details about what will be featured in the new maps, but he added that "the ambition is to try to pair it with some new type of experience, whether that's the map conditions or weather conditions we put in that make the play feel different, enemy types or compositions feeling different, or we're escalating the types of loot available there."As for the Arc Raiders content roadmap, Watkins suggested that it will be released "sometime soon." In the meantime, he confirmed that Embark is working on new weapons, objectives, and enemies in addition to the maps.Embark has also shared details and stats about its recently concluded Cold Snap event in Arc Raiders. According to Embark's numbers, 91 million players were knocked out by snowballs, but just under 11,000 enemies were taken out the same way.To date, Arc Raiders has passed 12.4 million in sales, it has earned hundreds of millions of dollars in revenue. Earlier this week, the latest Arc Raiders update nerfed some weapons and introduced new cosmetics.
